page.title: 12DALMENY AND POLLUTION
page.content: Pollution from the oil terminal at Hound Point and the marine terminal at Braefoot (the loading point for Mossmorran, a chemical works) presents a major threat to the river and the wildlife in the vicinity of Dalmeny. However, the Leith Ports Authority is very vigilant on this score. Hound Point has sophisticated equipment to cope with pollution-e.g. a computer capable of locating a major oil-spill occurring during darkness or fog. Fire fighting equipment is also located nearby. A permanently manned ship is also available to tackle any other emergency. Facilities are also available from the Braefoot terminal to cope with chemical pollution.
